children.text: To ensure your tooltips are properly accessible, you should do the following:
Use a focusable element for the tooltip target. This allows users who rely on a keyboard or screen reader to open the tooltip by focusing on the target element.
Link the tooltip content to the target element using unique IDs. Add the
attribute to your target element, and set its value to match the ID of the tooltip's content.
Provide a fallback description for screen readers using the
attribute. This is useful for when the tooltip content is not always rendered in the DOM.
